list_definition.mean_english: người bảo vệ rừng; bảo vệ công viên
list_definition.definition: a person who looks after a forest or park
a soldier who is a member of a specially trained force; commando

list_ex_of_english: On that basis, staff can be hired; rangers and conservation officers can be employed.
Can he tell us what sort of hours the rangers are allowed to work?
However, given that no alternative funding for wildlife protection is available outside the assisted areas, farmers in those areas could be hired as part-time rangers.
The issue of wardens and rangers was raised.
What will be the cost to local authorities for footpath upkeep and to provide rangers?
It relies on a large body of voluntary staff, including 200 rangers.
These flights, which we call "lone ranger" flights, are an invaluable exercise in flexibility.
Information on beach rangers is not collected centrally.
